intro: Quercus brachyclada, commonly known as the Chinese white oak, is a deciduous tree native to eastern China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Quercus brachyclada typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates.
